content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my risk-taking nature and the desire to maximize earnings, I would choose strategy R {R}.

Here's the reasoning: If my opponent also chooses R, we both earn 45$ per round, which is the highest possible payoff. However, if my opponent chooses B while I choose R, I lose the round and receive nothing, but they get 40$. Over 75 rounds, this would mean a net loss of 15$ (75 * 0 - 2 * 15).

On the other hand, if I choose B while my opponent chooses R, I gain 40$ per round and my opponent loses the round. Over 75 rounds, this would mean a net gain of 300$ (75 * 40 - 2 * 15).

Lastly, if we both choose B, we each earn 20$ per round, which nets me a total of 150$ over the 75 rounds.

Comparing these three scenarios, it's clear that choosing strategy R maximizes my potential earnings, even though I would lose money in some rounds if my opponent consistently chooses B. However, the high payoff for choosing R when my opponent chooses B more than makes up for those losses and allows me to earn more overall.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Given that I already made a choice in the previous scenario and my opponent also chose R, we both earned 45$ in the first round. Now it's time to move on to the next round.

In this round, I will stick with my initial choice of strategy R {R}. It's important to remember that our choices will affect our overall earnings over the course of 75 rounds. I will continue to choose strategy R as it offers the highest possible payoff if my opponent also chooses R, and the potential losses incurred when my opponent chooses B are mitigated by the high payoff when my opponent chooses R as well.
